N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 99 ยง 212 - Declaring a Disaster in Steuben County

State Regulations
WHEREAS, on August 18, 2021, and continuing thereafter, a
post-tropical cyclone impacted Steuben County creating hazardous conditions
affecting public health and safety; WHEREAS, this storm has produce significant rain causing
power outages, downed trees, localized flash flooding, road closures, travel
disruptions, and damage to public and private property throughout Steuben

County; NOW, THEREFORE, I, ANDREW M. CUOMO, Governor of the State of

New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution of the

State of New York and Section 28 of Article 2-B of the Executive Law, do hereby
find that a disaster exists for which the affected local governments are unable
to respond adequately. Therefore, I hereby declare a State Disaster Emergency
effective August 19, 2021 within the territorial boundaries of Steuben County. This Executive Order shall be in effect through September 18, 2021; and
FURTHER, pursuant to Section 29 of Article 2-B of the

Executive Law, I direct the implementation of the State Comprehensive Emergency

Management Plan and authorize State agencies, as necessary, and the American

Red Cross to take appropriate action to protect State property and to assist
affected local governments and individuals in responding to and recovering from
this disaster, and to provide such other assistance as necessary to protect the
public health and safety. Signed: Andrew M. Cuomo

Dated: August 19, 2021
